title: From Thirst-Quenching Stanleys to JBL Headphones – The 28 Best Budget-Friendly Christmas Gifts Under $25
summary: Christmas is just around the corner. Here's a list of affordable gifts for early-bird shoppers on a budget.
body: All products and services featured are independently chosen by editors. However, Billboard may receive a commission on orders placed through its retail links, and the retailer may receive certain auditable data for accounting purposes. Christmas is less than a month away, but you still have plenty of time to find the perfect gift. If you’re on a tight budget, we’ve put together a list of fun and affordable gifts for everyone on your list. From budget-friendly gift ideas to stocking stuffers, Secret Santa, White Elephant, Hanukkah and Kwanzaa gifts, this is the perfect list for shoppers who like to save while they spend. Below, find a roundup of the 28 best gifts under $25. Featured among the roundup are just over two dozen thoughtful and useful gifts for men, women and kids. For more gift ideas, be sure to read our roundup of Music-Inspired White Elephant Gifts , Best Buy deals and the best stocking stuffers for adults . Dosmix Retro Bluetooth Speaker $16.99 Buy Now On Amazon A retro-inspired speaker. You’ve likely never seen a Bluetooth speaker like this. title: Artemis II Vehicle Manager Branelle Rodriguez Gets Orion Ready for “Go”
summary: By the time the Artemis II Orion spacecraft launches to the Moon next year, its many components will already have traveled thousands of miles and moved across multiple facilities before coming together at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center. Branelle Rodriguez, Artemis II vehicle manager for the Orion Prog…
body: By the time the Artemis II Orion spacecraft launches to the Moon next year, its many components will already have traveled thousands of miles and moved across multiple facilities before coming together at NASA’s Kennedy Space Center. Branelle Rodriguez, Artemis II vehicle manager for the Orion Program, has overseen many parts of that journey. Her job is to ensure the spacecraft is ready for its historic mission – carrying humans to the Moon for the first time in over 50 years. Branelle Rodriguez crouches inside an Orion spacecraft training unit aboard the USS San Diego in March 2024. The training unit was used during a full recovery simulation with the Artemis II crew. Image courtesy of Branelle Rodriguez Based at NASA’s Johnson Space Center in Houston, Rodriguez has been involved in every stage of the spacecraft’s lifecycle – from development and production through testing and final launch readiness. Her program-level leadership focuses on ensuring the spacecraft’s hardware and subsystems are integrated and flight-ready. Most recently, she collaborated closely with Exploration Ground Systems at Kennedy to oversee the spacecraft’s move to the Vehicle Assembly Building, where it wa…

title: Samsung’s My Files might soon know when you’re on vacation — and act on it
summary: One UI's My Files app could soon know when you're traveling, and suggest you to clear up storage for vacation photos.
body: Credit: Andy Walker / Android Authority TL;DR Leaked One UI 8.5 firmware includes code that suggests the My Files app may detect when users are traveling. Subsequently, the app would suggest clearing storage to make room for vacation photos and videos. Thanks to a newer One UI 8.5 firmware floating around, numerous leaks have surfaced today regarding Samsung’s next update for Galaxy phones and tablets. We’ve spotted numerous UI changes, including updates to the Quick Settings pane l and the Settings app , as well as newer designs incorporated into apps such as Clock, Calculator, and Internet . We’ve even found design files for the Galaxy S26 series . One UI’s My Files app could also get a “ Short summary ” feature, and we’ve now spotted another thoughtful new feature that could save you some pain during vacations.
